input_text:
Job Title: Lead Mortgage Loan Originator- Bilingual

Location: Greater Houston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Job Details

Job Location

290 North Retail Center - HOUSTON, TX

Position Type

Full Time

Education Level

High School

Job Category

Banking

Description

 Department : Mortgage Operations Channel Reports To Mortgage Sales Manager 

 Employment Status: Full-Time Classification: Non-Exempt 

 Position Summary: 

The MLO is a tenured loan originator with knowledge of the loan process from application to closing/ funding. This role acts as the subject matter expert, delivering monthly gross loan funding of more than $1.5 million. The MLO has a strong working knowledge of the Encompass loan system and can quickly master third-party vendor websites like Rocket Mortgage, Equifax, and any other broker partners.

 Responsibilities  :

 Routinely maintain multiple pipelines: 1) in house, 2) brokered, 3) referrals  Interviewing prospects via telephone or in-person to gather information about their unique financial situations, needs, and objectives  Attend events representing the Credit Union  Working 2 Saturdays a month on call. Hours: 9-2  Conducting credit, DTI & financial analyses to qualify prospects for various loan programs via daily monitoring of the mortgage referral queue  Educating and advising prospects on the home buying process and how to best manage their mortgage and expectations  Ensuring exceptional experiences with ongoing communication throughout the entire loan process  Observing guidelines, policies, and procedures in order to adhere to compliance, regulations, and security standards  Maintain continuing education requirements to keep the NMLS license active  Demonstrating a functional knowledge of the Bank Secrecy Act in addition to other Federal laws, including but not limited to U.S. Patriot Act, Office of Foreign Assets & Control, Anti-Money Laundering, Right to Financial Privacy Act, and the Bank Bribery Act  Establishing positive and productive working relationships at all levels within the organization  Delivering world-call service and building member relationships  Participate in credit union goals like membership and deposits.  Facilitating discussions with prospects to uncover needs beyond those initially presented. Cross-sell our various products.  Evaluating credit reports to present members with appropriate PrimeWay products and services  Visits Primeway Retail Centers routinely  Making outbound phone calls to existing/potential members and, realtors & builders  Completing membership applications for prospective new members  Completing a full 1003 mortgage application  Originating and closing loans in an expedient manner by guiding the applicant through the process and setting proper expectations from application through to funding to all applicable parties (sales manager, processor, realtor, title, and borrowers)  Demonstrating accountability to achieve stated goals  Submitting internal business partner referrals when appropriate  “On call” mentality for emails, phone calls, texts, and Team's messages. Must be available with no interruptions (or obtain backup) during the office hours of Monday – Friday, 9 am, 9 am to 5 pm, and designated Saturday, 2 pm. 


Qualifications

 Knowledge and Skills 

 Ability to maintain significant levels of diplomacy and trust, in addition to normal courtesy and tact.  Outstanding organizational skills  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment  Excellent communication skills; ability to use applicable computer software  Ability to maintain a positive attitude and desire to help people truly  Ability to remain calm/ professional in stressful situations.  Entrepreneurial spirit  BILINGUAL (Spanish)  Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Encompass, Outlook 


Education And Experience

 High school education or GED 6 months – 2 years relevant experience  Current Mortgage Loan Officer: 3+ years of experience 


ADA Requirements

 Perform primarily sedentary work with limited physical exertion and occasional lifting of up to 5 lbs. Must be capable of climbing/descending stairs in emergency situations. Must be able to operate routine office equipment including telephone, copier, facsimile, and calculator. Must be able to routinely perform work on a computer for an average of 6-8 hours per day. Must be able to work extended hours whenever required or requested by management. Must be capable of regular, reliable, timely attendance.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Lead Mortgage Loan Originator- Bilingual
output_json.summary: A tenured loan originator with knowledge of the loan process from application to closing/funding.
job_responsibilities: Adhere to compliance, regulations, and security standards
Demonstrate knowledge of Bank Secrecy Act
output_json.physical_requirements: Primarily sedentary work with limited physical exertion
